title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1260.43 - Permission required for storage, handling or loading explosives or other dangerous articles barred by Federal regulations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1260.43 - Permission required for storage, handling or loading explosives or other dangerous articles barred by Federal regulations

State Regulations
(a) No reason shall, without prior
permission, keep, transport, handle or store at, in or upon an air terminal any
cargo of explosives or other dangerous articles which is barred from loading in
or transportation by civil aircraft in the United States under the current
provisions of part 103 of the Federal aviation regulations promulgated by the

Federal Aviation Administration. (b) Any waiver of such regulations or of any part thereof by the Federal Aviation

Administration or by any other competent authority shall not constitute or be
construed to constitute a waiver of this rule or an implied permission to keep, transport, handle or store such explosives or other dangerous articles at, in
or upon an air terminal. Advance notice of at least 24 hours shall be given the
manager to permit full investigation and clearance for any operation requiring
a waiver of this rule. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1260.43

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
